name: The Golden Goose
tagline: A vastness containing nothing but carpets of red, orange, and ochre moss. The wind howls.
description: A vastness containing nothing but carpets of red, orange, and ochre moss. The wind howls.

points_of_interest.name: Sidney's Company
points_of_interest.description: Roaming the featureless bogland is a small band of humans, miserable but determined.
points_of_interest.interior: Members: Sidney Tew, 4 minor nobles, and 4 ruffians (Level 1 thieves—DMB) on the hunt for a "golden goose that lays golden eggs."
points_of_interest.exploring: The hunt: Two weeks ago, a scavenger from Fort Vulgar sighted a "golden goose" here and found one of its golden eggs. He sold his egg and story to Sidney Tew, whose gang of second-son minor nobles and hangers-on headed out to find it before anyone else. The party is now (unknowingly) only a day away from discovering Crocus's Cave.
points_of_interest.inhabitants: Sidney Tew, 4 minor nobles, and 4 ruffians
special_features: Approaching: Sidney is suspicious but outwardly welcoming. He cannot help but brag about his search and shows the golden egg to those who doubt his claims.

points_of_interest.name: Crocus's Cave
points_of_interest.description: A large but obscured opening in the moss carpet leads downward into a sodden, high-ceilinged stone cave, filled with piles of reeds, bones, and shiny objects.
points_of_interest.interior: A sodden, high-ceilinged stone cave, filled with piles of reeds, bones, and shiny objects.
points_of_interest.inhabitants: The monstrous Crocus lies in wait here. She is accompanied by the Golden Goose, who is bound by a silver chain (100gp) and gagged with a cloth.
special_features: Treasure hoard: Amongst a collection of broken glass, polished metal, and worthless trinkets is 673cp, 432sp, 925gp, four golden eggs, and a pewter Talisman of Non-Detection (p398) shaped like a bisected eye.

items.name: Golden Egg
items.notes: Induces a subtle, covetous feeling in those who see it. After 4d6 days, the egg collapses into dust.

items.name: Talisman of Non-Detection
items.notes: Pewter talisman shaped like a bisected eye

treasure_hoard.worthless: broken glass, polished metal, and worthless trinkets

npcs.name: Crocus
npcs.description: A 10′ tall ogre-like fairy. She has no skin, just exposed muscle and patches of scab-like scales. Her lipless mouth is set in a permanent smile. Her fingers are tipped by teeth instead of nails. Until recently, avoiding her betrayed mistress Thorn-Rosy (p32) was her highest priority. Having finally grown too bored of hiding in a cave and eating wildlife, she now deliberately allows travellers to sight the goose, attracting greedy mortals to feed upon.
npcs.speech: Guttural growls and grunts. Basic Woldish, Sylvan.
desires: to avoid the wrath of Thorn-Rosy
and to be surrounded by shiny things
npcs.stat_reference: Ogre (DMB). As a fairy, suffers 1 extra point of damage when hit with cold iron weapons.

known_topics.content: Crocus's eyes fix on any shiny object presented to her. She reaches for it with grasping, tooth-tipped fingers, momentarily forgetting her hunger.

secret_info.content: Crocus stole the Golden Goose from her mistress, the Hag Thorn-Rosy. She lives in constant fear of discovery and punishment. Mentioning Thorn-Rosy's name causes her to flinch and glance nervously at shadows.
secret_info.hint: When fairy matters are discussed, her permanent smile seems to tighten, and she glances toward the cave entrance.

secret_info.content: Crocus deliberately allows travelers to sight the goose, using it as bait to attract greedy mortals she can feed upon. The whole 'hunt' is her trap.
secret_info.hint: The ease with which the golden egg was found seems almost... too convenient.

relationships.description: Fled from Thorn-Rosy after stealing the Golden Goose. Lives in terror of her wrath.
relationships.notes: Thorn-Rosy is referenced on p32 of the Campaign Book

relationships.description: Keeps the goose chained and gagged as both treasure and bait for prey.

npcs.name: Sidney Tew
npcs.description: A handsome human man in his 30s, with dashing blonde hair and sharp eyes, hailing originally from Prigwort. Dresses like a travelling noble, though his clothes are well-worn. Introduces himself as a cousin of the Lady Harrowmoor (p60)—this is true, though he is only a third cousin, once removed.
demeanor: but always looking for an angle
Will use a person, then feel bad about it to feel better about it
npcs.speech: Feigned noble affect. Woldish, Old Woldish.
desires: To assume a place of proper nobility and be recognised as a man of worth
He has engaged in innumerable failed schemes to do so, this goose venture being only the latest
If he survives, he will soon attempt another

possessions.name: Silver Longsword
possessions.description: A silver longsword engraved with the Tew name

known_topics.content: Sidney proudly produces a golden egg as proof of his quarry. 'Two weeks ago, a scavenger from Fort Vulgar spotted it - a goose with feathers of pure gold! I bought his egg and his story. We're close now, I can feel it.'

Sidney straightens with practiced dignity. 'I am a cousin of Lady Harrowmoor herself - third cousin, once removed, but blood is blood. The Tew name has a proud history, though circumstances have been... temporarily unfavorable.'

Sidney gestures vaguely at the featureless bog. 'We've been searching methodically. The scavenger said he saw it somewhere in this area. We're close - perhaps only a day or two from finding its lair.'

Sidney waves dismissively at his companions. 'Fine fellows all. The nobles are second sons seeking fortune - much like myself. The others are... practical men, shall we say. Reliable when properly compensated.'

secret_info.content: His claim to Lady Harrowmoor is technically true but practically meaningless - third cousin once removed grants no standing at court. He desperately hopes this venture will change his fortunes.
secret_info.hint: His clothes, though styled nobly, show careful mending and wear beyond their years.

secret_info.content: This goose venture is merely the latest in a long string of failed schemes. Previous attempts include a failed trading company, a collapsed mining investment, and a disastrous attempt to breed prize hunting dogs.
secret_info.hint: When pressed about his past, Sidney's confident demeanor falters momentarily, and he changes the subject.

relationships.description: Third cousin once removed. Claims kinship frequently but has no real standing.
relationships.notes: Lady Harrowmoor is referenced on p60 of the Campaign Book

npcs.name: The Golden Goose
npcs.description: An immortal goose with golden plumage. If its gag is removed, it repeatedly honks "Mother Rosy." It is otherwise unable to speak.
npcs.speech: If its gag is removed, it repeatedly honks "Mother Rosy." It is otherwise unable to speak.
secrets: The Golden Goose was once the prized possession of the fairy noble, the Hag Thorn-Rosy (p32), until her servitor Crocus stole it and fled to the mortal world
Thorn-Rosy bestows a significant reward upon whomever returns it, just as she would severely punish whomever keeps it from her

binding.on_ungag: Repeatedly honks 'Mother Rosy' - this may attract unwanted attention from Thorn-Rosy's agents

known_topics.content: When ungagged, the goose repeatedly honks 'Mother Rosy! Mother Rosy!' in an urgent, plaintive tone. It seems to be calling for its former owner.

secret_info.content: The Golden Goose was once the prized possession of the fairy noble Thorn-Rosy. She bestows a significant reward upon whomever returns it - and would severely punish whomever keeps it from her.
secret_info.hint: The goose's desperate honking of 'Mother Rosy' suggests powerful fairy connections.

relationships.description: The goose desperately calls for Thorn-Rosy when ungagged. Strong emotional bond.
relationships.notes: Thorn-Rosy is referenced on p32 of the Campaign Book

relationships.description: Kept chained and gagged by the ogre-fairy. Used as bait.

npcs.name: Minor Nobles
npcs.description: Four second-son minor nobles, hangers-on who joined Sidney's expedition hoping for wealth and adventure.

npcs.name: Ruffians
npcs.description: Four hired muscle, Level 1 thieves who do Sidney's dirty work.

known_topics.content: The ruffians exchange meaningful glances. 'Sidney pays, sure, but not as much as he promised. Says the big payout comes when we find the goose. Been hearing that for two weeks now.'
One ruffian spits into the bog. 'We've been traipsing through this muck for days. Some of the lads are starting to think this golden goose is just another of Sidney's fantasies.'

secret_info.content: The ruffians' loyalty extends exactly as far as Sidney's purse. A better offer - say, 50gp split among them - would have them looking the other way. 100gp would have them actively switching sides.
secret_info.hint: They count their coins frequently and cast calculating looks at the nobles' equipment.

secret_info.content: These aren't common laborers - they're Level 1 thieves with experience in violence. If threatened or cornered, they'll fight dirty and won't hesitate to abandon Sidney to save themselves.
secret_info.hint: Their hands never stray far from concealed blades, and they position themselves with exits in mind.

relationships.description: Hired muscle, loyal only while paid. Growing frustrated with delayed payment.

items.name: Golden Egg
items.description: A golden egg laid by the Golden Goose. Every 1d4 days, it lays a golden egg worth 40gp that induces a subtle, covetous feeling in those who see it. After 4d6 days, the egg collapses into dust.

items.name: Silver Chain
items.description: Silver chain binding the Golden Goose

items.name: Talisman of Non-Detection
items.description: A pewter Talisman of Non-Detection (p398) shaped like a bisected eye

dm_notes: Rewards: Promises a future payment in golden eggs in exchange for the PCs' assistance in obtaining the goose. Sidney's party is unknowingly a day away from discovering Crocus's Cave - this can be a timed event if the PCs don't find it first.
